algorithms

Class Algorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.Algorithm
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ADO, SDO, WelshPowell

    public abstract class Algorithm
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides the abstraction of an algorithm that can color a graph sequentially. Such a algorithm has to remember the coloring and has to provides methods to get a vertex which should be colored next as well as a legal color for such a vertex.

      The graph.

      • getColorForVertex

        public abstract int getColorForVertex(org.graphstream.graph.Node v)
        Get the next possible color for the given vertex. "Next" here means in the color ordering of the algorithm.
        Parameters:
        v - - the vertex
        Returns:
        -1 if the vertex is not colorable and the color as int else

      • colorVertex

        public void colorVertex(org.graphstream.graph.Node v,
               int color)
        Color the given vertex with the given color. This methods has to do all calls to make sure, that the neighborhood of v can not be colored with the color anymore.
        Parameters:
        v - - the vertex
        color - - the color
